publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1691 Robert Brown: Strategy for Play—That the Parliament notes the introduction of the UK Government’s play strategy for England and the commitment of £235 million over three years to fund the strategy including the rebuilding or renewal of playgrounds and the creation of supervised adventure playgrounds; notes with concern that many children have deficiencies in communication skills when they start school; welcomes the contribution that play makes to the development and life chances of children; believes that the time is ripe for the development of an innovative play and communication strategy for Scotland, and urges the Scottish Government to give play and communication a high priority in its programme.
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Elaine Smith*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jim Hume*, Jamie Stone*, Alison McInnes*, Ross Finnie*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Mike Pringle*

S3M-1691 Robert Brown: Strategy for Play—That the Parliament notes the introduction of the UK Government’s play strategy for England and the commitment of £235 million over three years to fund the strategy including the rebuilding or renewal of playgrounds and the creation of supervised adventure playgrounds; notes with concern that many children have deficiencies in communication skills when they start school; welcomes the contribution that play makes to the development and life chances of children; believes that the time is ripe for the development of an innovative play and communication strategy for Scotland, and urges the Scottish Government to give play and communication a high priority in its programme. Supported by: Rhoda Grant*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Hugh Henry*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Rhona Brankin*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Liam McArthur*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Bill Wilson*, Jackie Baillie*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Cathy Peattie*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Sarah Boyack*, Iain Gray*, Patrick Harvie*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Keith Brown*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Claire Baker*
S3M-1691 Strategy for Play (lodged on 10 April 2008) Dr Richard Simpson*
